parameters.definition: Units of the red liquid mixed in experiment 1
Units of the blue liquid mixed in experiment 1
Units of green gas produced in experiment 1
Units of smelly gas produced in experiment 1
Units of the red liquid mixed in experiment 2

Total units of red liquid available
Total units of blue liquid available
Maximum units of smelly gas allowed

description: A chemistry teacher teaches her students two experiments, experiment 1 and experiment 2. In experiment 1, \param{Red1} units of the red liquid and \param{Blue1} units of the blue liquid mix to create \param{Green1} units of green gas. In experiment 2, \param{Red2} units of the red liquid and \param{Blue2} units of the blue liquid mix to create \param{Green2} units of green gas. In addition, experiment 1 produces \param{Smelly1} units of smelly gas while experiment 2 produces \param{Smelly2} units of smelly gas. The lab has available \param{TotalRed} units of red liquid and \param{TotalBlue} units of blue liquid. If at most \param{MaxSmelly} units of smelly gas can be produced, how many experiments of each should be done to maximize the total amount of green gas produced?
